FuncDef:
The ptp enable command enables 1588v2 on a specific interface.
The undo ptp enable command disables 1588v2 on a specific interface.
By default, 1588v2 is disabled on an interface.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
1588v2 is enabled in the system and interface views:
Run the ptp enable command in the system view to enable 1588v2 on a device. 1588v2 functions can be configured in the system view.Run the ptp enable command to enable 1588v2 on an interface so that the interface can send and receive PTP packets. If an interface is selected as the beset master clock, the device where the interface resides can perform clock synchronization using the PTP packets received by the interface.
PTP can be enabled on only one interface of the OC.

Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
If port PTP needs to be enabled for an SMPTE-2059-2 network and Layer 3 packet encapsulation is not configured, the IP address of the management interface is used as the source IP address configured in the ptp udp-egress source-ip command.
After the undo ptp udp-egress source-ip command is run on an SMPTE-2059-2 interface, the PTP function is automatically disabled.
